For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

### PR summary [52af4b65b4](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/16481/commits/52af4b65b45d4cffe8cbf5628d501377625696be)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

No declarations were harmed in the making of this PR! üêô
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.
üöÄ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by joneugster.
Looks good to me also; thanks for fixing this quickly!
Not sure how I removed the "maintainer-merge" label, bad internet connection maybe??

Thanks! See questions above.
bors d+

:v: adomani can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

I think that it would be better to not hard-code the value of the weak option in the linter, but I do not know if it is possible to retrieve that value.  I am going to merge as is, since it works as is.  The only issue is that, should the default maximum length of a file change from 1500 to some other number of lines, then the value would have to be changed also in the linter.

bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10716649368/job/29714607880)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10716649368/job/29714606870)
maintainer merge
maintainer merge
Doesn't this hardcode the value of `1500` ignoring the option? Probably, no (otherwise CI would fail), but I don't understand why. Also, did you test it with a downstream project?

1. As you say, this does not hard-code the linter option, since otherwise CI would have failed on long files. It *does* hard-code what the linter considers to be the expected length of a file. `defValue` is used to inform the user that they should not use `set_option linter.style.longFile x` with `x ‚â§ 1500`. It would be nice to be able to retrieve the value of the `weak` option set in the lake-file, but I am doubtful of whether that is accessible or not.
2. I did test downstream and the linter is indeed not flagging long files in the test-project that I used.
Maybe as a further clarification, the `defValue` that you flagged is *not* `linter.style.longFile.defValue`: the former is 1500, the latter is 0.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - fix: disable the longFile linter in downstream projects
